F1_technology.name: AI & Technology
F1_technology.key_metric: Triple frontier launch (Opus 4.6 + GPT-5.3-Codex + Gemini 3 same day); Chinese AI Spring (5 labs at frontier simultaneously); DeepSeek V4 imminent
key_data: OpenAI Frontier: first enterprise agent management platform launched Feb 5, 2026 (Intuit, Uber, State Farm, Thermo Fisher)
Claude Opus 4.6: agent teams with multi-agent parallel task decomposition; 500+ zero-day vulnerabilities discovered in testing
DeepSeek V4 expected Feb 17, 2026: 1M+ token context, Engram conditional memory, targeting SWE-bench parity with Opus 4.5
Open-proprietary gap approaching real-time parity (<2 weeks lag)
AI coding productivity 20-30% in specific workflows; experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks (perception-reality gap)
NVIDIA Blackwell backlog 3.6M units, $500B orders booked through end-2026
China controls 90% humanoid robot market; Unitree 5,500 units, AgiBot 5,168 (both exceed Tesla's 5,000 target)
Tesla Optimus Gen 3 mass production launched Jan 21, 2026 but Musk admits no Optimus doing 'useful work'
FDA deregulates AI clinical decision support (Jan 6, 2026) — AI single-recommendation CDS exempt from device regulation
HBR: 60% of orgs reduced headcount anticipating AI, only 2% tied to actual AI implementation — 'anticipatory displacement'
Trump AI EO creates AI Litigation Task Force to challenge state AI laws; FTC/Commerce March 11 deadlines imminent
AI coding: 25-40% of Google code AI-generated; GitHub Copilot 20M+ users, 90% Fortune 100
Enterprise GenAI spending $37B in 2025 (3.2x YoY); 66% report productivity gains but enterprise-wide EBIT impact still rare
Agentic AI shifting from single-task to multi-step autonomous workflows — now platform-level deployment
F1_technology.2031_projection: Early Deployment phase — AI shifts from infrastructure build to systematic economic integration. Triple frontier launch (Feb 5) + Chinese AI Spring (5 labs) confirms AI is a race, not a march. Open-source parity measured in days. Multi-agent orchestration deployed at enterprise scale.

F2_demographics.name: Demographics
F2_demographics.key_metric: Healthcare monoculture: 95% of Jan 2026 job creation; BLS 898K revision (1.7M cumulative overstatement); H-1B wage-weighted lottery Feb 27 binary event
key_data: China 2025 births: 7.92M (from 9.54M, -17%) — comparable to 1738 when population was 150M
China women aged 20-34: 105M (2025) -> 58M by 2050 (-45%) — irreversible demographic decline
Japan: sub-670,000 births (record low); 3.6 trillion yen ($22.3B) annual family spending from FY2026
US Jan 2026 BLS: +130K jobs but 898K DOWNWARD revision to 2025 employment — labor market far weaker than believed
Healthcare dominates: +82K of +130K January jobs (63% of all new jobs)
JOLTS Dec 2025: 6.54M openings (pandemic-era low), 0.87 jobs per unemployed (from 2+ in 2022)
College enrollment cliff: 15% decline projected 2025-2029, up to 80 additional closures, 400 schools could vanish this decade
Five states = 75% of college decline: IL, CA, NY, PA, MI; South only region with 3% increase
Silver Tsunami: $68T boomer wealth transferring by 2030, $5.1T in small business value, 58% no succession plan
H-1B $100K fee: startups 10-20% of revenue, IT services $500M+ impact; wage-weighted lottery effective Feb 27, 2026
Entry-level hiring collapse: 67% drop in junior developer roles; 37% of managers prefer AI over hiring Gen Z
Pipeline collapse: CPA -33%, nursing 78K->200K, teaching 42 states (411K vacant), trucking age 57
F2_demographics.2031_projection: Three demographic regimes diverge irreversibly. China's childbearing cohort halving locks in automation necessity. US labor market bifurcates: healthcare/trades structural shortage while cognitive sectors shed workers. College enrollment cliff triggers institutional consolidation cascade.

F3_geopolitics.name: Geopolitics
F3_geopolitics.key_metric: ReArm Europe EUR 800B; India zero-tax AI through 2047; China targets 80% domestic AI chip capture by end-2026
key_data: US-China tariff truce at risk: 25% Iran-linked tariff threatens Nov 2025 trade deal; 47.5% avg US tariff on China
EU Digital Omnibus: AI Act high-risk Annex III delayed Aug 2026 -> Dec 2027; conditional on standards readiness
ReArm Europe/Readiness 2030: EUR 800B defense mobilization, EUR 150B SAFE loan instrument, 1.5% GDP escape clause
India zero-tax on cloud/AI revenues through 2047; $70-100B from Google/Amazon/Microsoft; 9.2 GW data center target by 2030
India AI Impact Summit Feb 16-20: first Global South AI summit, 100+ US firms, 100+ countries
AUKUS Pillar II: autonomous maritime warfare trials expanding 2026; AI models proven interoperable across national platforms
China targets tripling domestic AI chip production; 80% domestic capture by end-2026; 3 new fabs planned
Gulf AI execution: Saudi+UAE $200B+ combined; HUMAIN deploying 18,000 GB300 GPUs; UAE Stargate 1GW cluster
Trump AI EO: AI Litigation Task Force vs 280 bipartisan state lawmakers; FTC/Commerce Mar 11 deadlines
CMMC 2.0 enforcement ramping: 220K+ DIB companies must certify; only 60 C3PAOs
Defense tech VC doubled to $17.9B equity (2.45x YoY); exits record $54.4B; Nvidia/Groq $20B acquisition
Global defense spending $2.75T in 2026; Pentagon FY2026 $961.6B + $150B reconciliation
F3_geopolitics.2031_projection: Three AI blocs consolidate. India emerges as third compute center alongside US and Gulf. European defense rearmament supercycle reshapes continental industrial base. Federal-state AI regulatory conflict in US creates maximum compliance uncertainty through 2027.

F4_capital.name: Capital Flows
F4_capital.key_metric: Office CMBS 12.34% (all-time record, worse than 2008); AI mega-rounds: OpenAI $100B, Anthropic $20B, xAI $20B
key_data: Office CMBS delinquency: 12.34% (Jan 2026, all-time record — 1.6pp above 2008 Financial Crisis peak)
Net $1.6B increase in delinquent office CMBS loans in January alone
CRE maturities 2026: $936B-$1.8T; new loan rate 6.24% vs 4.76% expiring = 148bp gap
Anthropic: $20B+ round at $350B valuation (doubled in 5 months from $175B)
OpenAI: assembling $100B round at $830B valuation (166x revenue multiple)
xAI: $20B Series E at $230B valuation; Humans&: $480M seed at $4.48B (unicorn at seed in 3 months)
Fed holds 3.50-3.75%; 2 FOMC dissents (Miran, Waller) favoring cut; futures: at most 2 cuts in 2026, zero in 2027
Defense tech exits $54.4B (3x YoY, record); exits exceed investment ($54.4B vs $49.1B) — maturing market
S&P 500 concentration at record: top 10 = 40% of index weight; forward P/E at 22x (matching 2021 peak)
PE-backed bankruptcies trending upward; healthcare and higher education as new PE distress sectors
Private credit emerges as dominant distress liquidity source; liability management exercises dominating restructuring
VC 2026 outlook: 10-25% funding increase; robotics + defense gaining share; climate tech, crypto losing share
Enterprise GenAI spending $37B (3.2x YoY); AI deals convert at 47% vs 25% SaaS
F4_capital.2031_projection: Capital rotation from pure-digital to hard-tech/physical accelerates. Office CRE enters terminal repricing (worse than 2008). PE refinancing wall forces restructuring. AI capital concentrates in frontier labs ($140B+ in Jan-Feb 2026 alone) while marginal AI startups starved.

F5_psychology.name: Psychology & Fear
F5_psychology.key_metric: Worker fear 60% (up from 40%); entry-level -67%; 90% online content may be synthetic by 2026; fear now experiential (1 in 5 knows someone)
key_data: Worker AI fear escalated: 60% expect AI to cut more jobs than it adds (up from 40% baseline); 51% worried about own job
Fear now EXPERIENTIAL: 1 in 5 workers knows someone who lost their job to AI — transitions from abstract to personal
AI-washing layoffs: 108,435 Jan 2026 job cuts (+118% YoY); companies citing AI potential not performance
Entry-level hiring collapse: 67% drop in junior developer roles; 35% decline in all entry-level postings since Jan 2023
37% of managers prefer AI over hiring Gen Z worker
Deepfake crisis: Europol projects 90% of online content may be synthetic by 2026; 8M deepfakes in 2025 (16x from 2023)
Liar's Dividend: authentic content dismissed as fake — systemic trust destruction
Consumer sentiment K-shaped: Michigan 57.3 (6-month high) but 7-point gap wealthy vs hourly; spending-confidence decoupled
Baby boomers: 35% decrease in AI confidence; Gen X: 25% decrease
Education: Brookings 50-country study finds AI risks outweigh benefits for children; Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026
2026 state AI legislation: Michigan proposes civil+punitive damages for harmful chatbots to minors; new targets: agentic AI, algorithmic pricing
Enterprise ROI: 66% report productivity gains, 40% higher quality, 3+ hours saved weekly — but enterprise EBIT impact still rare
Trust premium: 23% willing to pay 15-20% for human services
F5_psychology.2031_projection: Psychology ACCELERATES as structural force. Fear transitions from anticipatory to experiential, driving faster demand for safety/governance/verification infrastructure. Deepfake crisis creates systemic trust collapse requiring verification infrastructure at scale. K-shaped sentiment entrenches parallel economies.

F6_energy.name: Energy & Resources
F6_energy.key_metric: IEA: global data center electricity doubling to 945 TWh by 2030; PJM capacity auction $16.4B record; solar credit terminated
key_data: IEA confirms: global data center electricity doubling to 945 TWh by 2030 (= Japan's entire economy)
US data center electricity: 133% growth to 426 TWh by 2030; AI servers growing 30%/yr vs 9% conventional
Data center electricity growth 15%/yr — 4x faster than all other sectors combined
Data center occupancy projected 95%+ peak in late 2026 — capacity crisis imminent
PJM capacity auction: $16.4B record (3rd consecutive); data centers 63% of price increase ($9.3B)
Microsoft piloting zero-water data center cooling in Phoenix/Wisconsin (2026) — trades water for energy
Copper: ICSG warns 150K-tonne deficit 2026; Citi: $13,000-15,000/tonne; counter: Red Cloud sees surplus from tariffs
Long-term copper deficits: 555K tonnes by 2029, 766K by 2030; data centers 330-500K tonnes/yr by 2030
NVIDIA $500B orders booked through end-2026, driving compute infrastructure chain pressure
Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill: residential solar credit terminated Dec 2025; wind/solar phase-out by Jul 2026
Despite credit removal, solar LCOE $38-78/MWh still competitive but 15-30% more expensive
70 GW solar scheduled for 2026-2027 (rush to build before credit expiry)
Nuclear renaissance: 10GW+ committed for AI data centers; solar employment +51.6% YoY (fastest growing sub-sector)
F6_energy.2031_projection: Energy becomes THE binding constraint on AI scaling. Data center capacity crisis hits late 2026 (95% occupancy). Renewable incentive removal creates investment cliff post-2027, shifting generation mix toward nuclear and natural gas. Geographic winners defined by power access and grid capacity.

Parallel AI chip ecosystem: 3 new fabs, 80% domestic capture target
State-directed capital allocation

key_metrics.rearmament: EUR 150B SAFE loan + 1.5% GDP escape clause

Drones and air defense prioritized for 2026

japan.name: Japan
top_forces: Most acute demographic laboratory — 18th consecutive year of population decline
Highest robot density globally
$22.3B annual family spending from FY2026 — largest pronatalist commitment
Care economy crisis
japan.2031_outlook: Template for every aging economy — solutions that work in Japan export to US/EU within 5-15 years. $22.3B annual family spending tests whether policy can affect birth rates.

india.name: India

key_metrics.ai_tax_policy: Zero tax on cloud revenues through 2047

top_forces: Zero-tax-through-2047 policy: most aggressive AI attraction policy globally
$70-100B hyperscaler commitments (Google, Amazon, Microsoft)
AI Impact Summit Feb 2026: first Global South AI summit, 100+ countries
Demographic dividend peak until 2055, 13,500 IndiaAI Fellowship scholars
india.2031_outlook: Third global AI compute center alongside US and Gulf. Zero-tax policy attracts global workloads. 1M AI professionals by 2026. Education-tech and reskilling epicenter.

latam.name: Latin America
top_forces: Nearshoring wave from US-China decoupling
Extreme urbanization concentrates markets
Weak incumbents = lower entry barriers
latam.2031_outlook: Nearshoring-driven manufacturing growth, Brazil as regional AI leader, Argentina reform experiment

top_forces: Saudi+UAE: $200B+ combined AI investment — executing, not just announcing
HUMAIN deploying 18,000 GB300 GPUs; UAE Stargate 1GW cluster
Positioning as neutral AI compute hub in US-China bifurcation
Oil-to-AI conversion at unprecedented scale
mena.2031_outlook: Third global AI capital center alongside US and China, massive infrastructure buildout, neutral compute zone creates arbitrage opportunity between US-China blocs

africa.name: Africa
top_forces: Only continent with explosive working-age growth
Mobile-first leapfrog pattern
Infrastructure the binding constraint
africa.2031_outlook: Largest untapped market for AI-native services, mobile-first model, constrained by connectivity and digital skills

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 34-point trust gap: providers 7/10 vs patients 3.6/10. FDA deregulated AI CDS (Jan 2026) — faster innovation but potentially wider trust gap. Patient trust, opacity, liability, clinical vs admin split
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Admin/back-office AI normalized, clinical AI accelerates under deregulation but patient trust gap persists

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 82% ethical concern rate — highest fear friction of any professional sector. Billable-hour conflict, 700+ AI hallucination court cases, liability
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: AI-augmented practice standard, human judgment premium remains

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: HIGHEST gap measured. 55% uncomfortable. Brookings 50-country study: AI risks outweigh benefits for children. Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026. Parents report child anxiety from AI learning targets. Entry sequence: corporate (gap 2) -> teacher-facing (gap 2) -> university admin (gap 3) -> student-facing (gap 6)
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Multi-path transformation: corporate reskilling first, K-12 student-facing last. $5-10B governance sub-market.

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 98% AI adoption — virtually universal. LOWEST fear friction of any sector — the control group. Second-order cascade modeled: $800B-$1.2T value reallocation. Office CMBS delinquency 12.34% (record, worse than 2008).
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Heavy AI back-office, human-in-loop client-facing, cascade restructuring complete

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 500K labor gap makes automation non-optional. 78-point readiness gap (98% exploring, 20% deployed). China 90% humanoid robot market share.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: 95% plan automation by 2028, robotics standard in new facilities, cobot ROI 6-18mo

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Business model conflict, expertise identity, client trust. Entry-level hiring collapse: 67% junior dev drop, 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Barbell: routine cognitive eliminated, judgment premium rises

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Identity/authenticity crisis, union action, human premium demand. Deepfake crisis: 8M in 2025 (16x from 2023), Europol projects 90% synthetic content by 2026.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Parallel artisan economy, verification infrastructure, premium human content

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: 80% automation risk in call centers, but 86% want human interaction
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Automated base layer, human premium tier, loyalty-driven differentiation

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Fear runs OPPOSITE: fear of NOT adopting AI while adversaries do. CMMC enforcement ramping (220K companies, only 60 C3PAOs). Defense tech exits $54.4B (3x YoY). AUKUS AI interoperability proven. $13.4B DoD AI budget.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Full AI operationalization, regulatory moat protects first movers, talent supply is the bottleneck not willingness

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Baumol 2.13x (highest uncovered sector), 3M workers. Internal bifurcation: computing infrastructure (518) growing +4.1% while motion picture production collapsed -24.1%. Software publishers (648K workers at $200K) face AI code generation threat. Internet publishing -6.4% with wages surging +16.4% = classic Baumol squeeze. The sector that builds AI is also disrupted by it.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: AI infrastructure sub-sectors grow; content creation and traditional software sub-sectors contract. Barbell: elite platforms absorb value while mid-tier collapses.

fear_friction_index.primary_drivers: Binding constraint on AI scaling. Baumol 1.77x, 576K workers growing +3.9%. Solar employment +51.6% (fastest in economy). Nuclear workforce expanding. PJM capacity auction $16.4B record. Data centers responsible for 63% of price increase. AI transforms utility operations (grid optimization, predictive maintenance) while AI demand restructures generation mix.
fear_friction_index.2031_projection: Energy becomes gatekeeper of AI deployment. Generation mix shifts to nuclear+solar for AI workloads. Geographic winners defined by grid capacity. Data center share of US electricity reaches 6-12%.

key_findings.title: Fear Is a Market, Not Just Sentiment
key_findings.detail: Fear-driven markets (safety, compliance, governance, ethics, insurance, verification) total ~$86B by 2030. Deepfake crisis (8M in 2025, 90% synthetic by 2026) creates systemic trust destruction and massive verification infrastructure demand. AI Ethics Consulting alone at 45.9% CAGR.

key_findings.title: The Great Anticipatory Overshoot
key_findings.magnitude: 60% of orgs reduced headcount anticipating AI; only 2% from actual AI
key_findings.detail: HBR Jan 2026 confirms: 60% of organizations reduced headcount anticipating AI, while only 2% tied to actual AI implementation. 108,435 Jan 2026 job cuts (+118% YoY). Fear is now bilateral and EXPERIENTIAL — 1 in 5 workers knows someone who lost their job to AI. Anticipatory displacement creates self-fulfilling prophecy.

key_findings.title: Three Demographic Regimes Diverge Irreversibly
key_findings.magnitude: China births at 1738 levels; childbearing cohort halving by 2050
key_findings.detail: Shrinking: China births -17% to 7.92M (comparable to 1738 population of 150M), women 20-34 declining from 105M to 58M by 2050 — irreversible. Japan sub-670K births. US 898K downward job revision reveals weaker market. Peak dividend: India zero-tax AI policy, $70-100B hyperscaler investment. Pre-dividend: Africa 830M youth by 2050.

key_findings.title: Perez Turning Point Approaching
key_findings.detail: AI frontier lab raises exceed $140B in Jan-Feb 2026 alone (OpenAI $100B, Anthropic $20B, xAI $20B). S&P 500 top 10 at 40% concentration (record). But defense tech exits ($54.4B) exceed investment — Installation->Deployment transition signal. Disciplined enterprise AI buying (fewer licenses, higher spend per license) suggests late Installation phase.

key_findings.title: Human Premium Is Durable
key_findings.detail: Deepfake crisis (90% synthetic content projected) accelerates demand for verification infrastructure. 86% of consumers want human interaction. 23% willing to pay 15-20% premium. Liar's Dividend effect — authentic content dismissed as fake — creates systemic trust collapse requiring new authentication layer.

key_findings.title: Energy Is the Gatekeeper
key_findings.magnitude: IEA: 945 TWh data center electricity by 2030; 95% occupancy crisis late 2026
key_findings.detail: IEA confirms global data center electricity doubling to 945 TWh by 2030 (= Japan). Data center occupancy projected 95%+ in late 2026 — physical capacity crisis. PJM capacity auction $16.4B record, data centers 63% of price increase. Solar credit terminated but 70 GW rush-to-build. Microsoft piloting zero-water cooling (trades water for energy). Copper deficits widen to 766K tonnes by 2030.

key_findings.title: Three AI Blocs + India Emerging as Fourth Center
key_findings.detail: US-led (innovation-first, federal-state conflict), China-led (80% domestic chip capture target, 90% humanoid robot market), EU-regulated (Digital Omnibus delays, ReArm Europe EUR 800B). India emerges as swing player with zero-tax policy through 2047 and $70-100B hyperscaler investment, creating third compute center. Gulf ($200B+ combined) as fourth capital center.

key_findings.title: Entry-Level Extinction Crisis
key_findings.magnitude: 67% junior dev hiring drop; 35% all entry-level postings since Jan 2023
key_findings.detail: Junior developer hiring collapsed 67%. All entry-level postings down 35% since Jan 2023 (Revelio Labs). 37% of managers prefer AI over hiring Gen Z. Only 7% of new hires are recent graduates. This is not cyclical — it is a structural break in the apprenticeship pipeline. 67% fewer juniors in 2026 means 67% fewer potential leaders in 2031-2036.

key_findings.title: Financial Services Cascade Fully Modeled
key_findings.magnitude: First sector to cross phase threshold — $800B-$1.2T value reallocation
key_findings.detail: Financial services in acceleration phase. Office CMBS delinquency hit 12.34% (all-time record, 1.6pp worse than 2008). $936B-$1.8T CRE maturing 2026. Cascade: AI adoption -> job displacement -> CRE impact -> bank stress -> credit tightening. PE-backed healthcare and higher education entering distress. Mortgage servicing: -10.7% employment but +13.8% wages = acute AI necessity.

key_findings.title: Agentic AI Platforms Arrive — Enterprise Deployment Phase Begins
key_findings.magnitude: OpenAI Frontier + Claude Opus 4.6 agent teams launched same week (Feb 5)
key_findings.detail: Two frontier labs shipped enterprise agentic AI platforms in the same week. OpenAI Frontier manages agents as employees (open platform). Claude Opus 4.6 agent teams enable multi-agent parallel task decomposition. DeepSeek V4 approaching parity at open-weight pricing. This shifts agentic AI from experimental to platform-level deployment. Enterprise GenAI spending $37B (3.2x YoY) but shifting to disciplined, fewer-but-better licenses.

sentiment_trajectory.metric: Workers expecting net AI job losses

defense_ai.aukus_status: AI interoperability proven across national platforms

turning_point_signals: CEO ROI disappointment (80%+ no EBIT impact)
Forward P/E at 22x (matching 2021 peak, near 2000 record 24x)
Defense tech exits exceed investment — Deployment phase signal
Fewer AI licenses but higher spend per license — selection phase

8 newly scored from deep dive (MC-EDU-CORP-01 through MC-EDU-FEAR-01)

Mortgage and Loan Servicing AI Operations Platform

20 new model cards integrated (325→345 total rated models)
49 new signals scanned across all 6 forces
2 new patterns confirmed: P-039 (Healthcare Employment Monoculture), P-040 (Securities Inverse Baumol)
Triple frontier AI launch: Opus 4.6 + GPT-5.3-Codex + Gemini 3 on same day (Feb 5)
Chinese AI Spring: 5 labs at near-frontier simultaneously — export controls strategically irrelevant
Healthcare monoculture: 95% of Jan 2026 net job creation in one sector
BLS 898K revision + 818K prior = 1.7M cumulative overstatement — 2024 economy weaker than reported
H-1B wage-weighted lottery effective Feb 27 — binary event for IT services labor supply
Securities inverse Baumol: highest Baumol sector (3.71x) shows wages DOWN while employment UP
Management sector identified as economy's coordination overhead layer — 55% routine-cognitive, Coasean compression
Real Estate confirmed as primary cascade receptor — CMBS + remote work + AI workforce reduction converge

sector_transformations.name: Financial Services
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: Office CMBS 12.34% (all-time record, worse than 2008). Mortgage servicing: -10.7% employment but +13.8% wages = acute AI necessity. Financial activities lost 22K jobs in Jan 2026. PE-backed bankruptcies trending into healthcare and education.

sector_transformations.name: Professional Services
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: Entry-level hiring collapse: 67% junior dev drop, 35% all entry-level since Jan 2023. 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z. Experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks (perception gap). Agentic AI platforms (Frontier, Opus 4.6) target professional workflows.

sector_transformations.name: Manufacturing
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: China 90% humanoid robot market. Tesla Optimus Gen 3 mass production but no useful work. NVIDIA $500B order backlog drives compute infrastructure manufacturing. Cobot ROI 6-18mo confirmed.

sector_transformations.name: Healthcare
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: Healthcare +82K jobs in Jan 2026 (63% of all new jobs) — Baumol destination sector. FDA deregulates AI CDS (Jan 6, 2026). 40%+ nurses considering leaving. PE-backed healthcare entering distress phase.

sector_transformations.name: Administrative Services
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: 108,435 Jan 2026 layoffs (+118% YoY). AI-washing layoffs: companies cite AI potential not performance. Staffing canary confirmed: RHI -53%, MAN -44%. Oxford Economics: 'firms don't appear to be replacing workers with AI on a significant scale.'

sector_transformations.name: Construction
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: Construction +33K in Jan 2026. Data center construction driving demand. 70 GW solar rush-to-build before Jul 2026 credit expiry. AEC design/permitting AI emerging (MC-V35-5413-001).

sector_transformations.name: Wholesale Trade
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: US-China tariff truce at risk from Iran linkage. 47.5% average US tariff on Chinese goods. $1,300/household tariff tax estimated.

sector_transformations.name: Defense AI
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: PHASE UPGRADED: early_disruption -> acceleration. Defense tech exits $54.4B (3x YoY, exceed investment). AUKUS AI interoperability proven. ReArm Europe EUR 800B. CMMC enforcement ramping. MC-DEF-011 (CMMC Compliance) scores 82.5, enters top 10. 8 defense cards scored avg 74.8.

sector_transformations.name: Educational Services
sector_transformations.v36_evidence: College enrollment cliff NOW: 15% decline projected 2025-2029, 400 schools could vanish. Brookings: AI risks outweigh benefits for children. Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026. 8 education cards scored avg 68.9 (fear friction constrains). MC-EDU-FEAR-01 creates new FEAR_ECONOMY category for education governance.

sector_transformations.name: IT Services
sector_transformations.v37_evidence: NEW v3-7 deep dive. 2.46M workers, $366.8B payroll, Baumol 2.05x. Custom programming (541511) = 1.11M workers at $164K, highest AI substitution potential. 84% developers using AI coding daily. Employment flat (-0.4%) while wages +5% = Baumol squeeze onset. Extreme fragmentation (405K establishments, avg 6.1 workers). Solo/micro IT consultants (250K+) lose cost advantage to AI tools.

sector_transformations.name: Management of Companies
sector_transformations.v37_evidence: NEW v3-7 deep dive. Economy's COMMAND AND CONTROL layer: 2.55M workers, $375B payroll, Baumol 2.02x. 55% routine-cognitive (reporting, budgets, coordination). Gartner: 20% of orgs eliminating >50% middle management by 2026. McKinsey cutting 10% workforce. Coasean theory: when AI collapses coordination cost, this sector's rationale weakens.

sector_transformations.name: Real Estate
sector_transformations.v37_evidence: NEW v3-7 deep dive. Primary SECOND-ORDER CASCADE RECEPTOR. Most fragmented major sector (488K establishments, avg 4.9 workers). CMBS 12.34% + $936B maturity wall + remote work + AI workforce reduction converge simultaneously. Office values 35-50% below 2020 peaks. NAR settlement + AI agents = existential pressure on 453K brokers.

sector_transformations.name: Securities & Investments
sector_transformations.v37_evidence: NEW v3-7 deep dive. Highest Baumol (3.71x), $287B payroll. KEY DIVERGENCE: wages DECLINING (-2.4%) while employment GROWS (+4.1%) = inverse Baumol. Structural shift from high-comp traders to AI-augmented ops. RIA M&A record 345 deals ($1.22T). 38% advisors plan to retire within decade. Entry-level analyst hiring -24pp.

cycle_history.note: PIVOT: Economy mapping. 6 forces, 8 regions, fear friction, demographics, geopolitics.
First institutional-grade cycle: 5-axis rating, 15 model cards, 5 sector briefs, 4 geographic reports, 84 signals graded.

PIVOT BACK: Models as central output. 235 v2 models individually migrated through 5-axis rating, 287 algorithmically estimated, 45 NEW models from macro gaps (defense, education, fear, energy, geo, emerging). Economy map is grading context, not standalone output.

System audit: batch normalization, GG->EC replacement, category hard-enforcement (STRUCTURAL_WINNER 27->8), dedup (295->293), agent prompt rewrite, top-down enumeration pipeline (2,823 stubs). Engine integrity restored.

Sector deep dives (defense, education), FS cascade modeling, force refresh, 31 new model cards from deep dives. 3 new patterns (P-033, P-034, P-035). 2 new sectors tracked (Defense AI, Education). F5 velocity shifted, F4 PE trigger activated.

43 signals + 10 counter-signals scanned. 32 deep-dive cards scored. 3 new patterns (P-036, P-037, P-038). F2/F5 UPGRADED accelerating. Defense UPGRADED acceleration. Sector screener identifies 10 candidates.

4 sector deep dives: IT Services (NAICS 5415, 2.46M workers, Baumol 2.05x), Management (NAICS 55, 2.55M workers — economy's command/control layer), Real Estate (NAICS 53, cascade receptor, most fragmented sector), Securities (NAICS 523, highest Baumol 3.71x, inverse Baumol divergence). 49 signals scanned. 2 new patterns: P-039 (Healthcare Monoculture — 95% of job creation), P-040 (Securities Inverse Baumol — wages down while employment up). Triple frontier launch (Opus 4.6 + GPT-5.3-Codex + Gemini 3). Chinese AI Spring (5 labs at frontier simultaneously). BLS 898K revision (1.7M cumulative overstatement). H-1B wage-weighted lottery Feb 27 binary event. 20 new model cards integrated (325→345).
